column4: what kernel ver do you have? there were some issues with not recognizing sata2 a while back
2.6.12-9 caused problems with me here with amd64 not dual core.....both 64 and 32 mode problems seeing sata correctly.....fixed in 2.6.15
I don't see that one in my list with packages?
you got a dual boot windows setup?
If you want, I'd personally make a backup image of your current install and try changing sources to 6.04 dapper and apt-get update then apt-get dist-upgrade and get current kernel.....
then if doesn't fix sata2 prob you could fall back on backup image
I'll try that then I think... thanks :)
I also remember seeing some posts i think was on bugzilla.ubuntu.com about sata issues
Prolly the last time I buy me modern stuff, hehe... couldn't get Mandriva to install at all

don't think is smp prob...but could be wrong.....what happened here was I have 2 sata drives and went from 2.6.12-7 to 2.6.12-9 and 2nd sata would not detect in ubuntu but when i went to 2.6.12-10 it worked fine
so you could look for more current 2.6.12-x in curent packages to see before changing too dapper...
In my case it would not even boot, said it could not open /dev/sda1 for writing (!?)
